intro: Phyllanthus pseudocarunculatus, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and typically grows as a shrub or small tree. The plant features alternate, simple leaves with a distinctive waxy coating, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are often yellow or greenish in color. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
